DOCNAME: CASE OF CUSTERS, DEVEAUX AND TURK v. DENMARK
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE an NORP air base was established on the FAC peninsula in LOC of north - west GPE . With the establishment of an anti - aircraft artillery unit in DATE the air base area was expanded . It was reduced in size in DATE and in DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicants were members of ORG . In DATE they took part in an action around FAC designed to draw international attention to the use of a radar ( FAC ) for the NORP missile defence programme and to collect information on the environmental impact of the presence of the air base on the FAC peninsula .

CARDINAL . Before the action in question , on DATE , CARDINAL ORG members had had a meeting with the Chief of Police of GPE , during which they had been informed of the legislation relating to FAC and the consequences of a possible refusal by the relevant authorities of permission to visit the air base area .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested permission to visit “ the FAC peninsula around FAC ” . By fax of DATE ORG informed ORG that FAC , including the FAC area , was a “ defence area ” , and that civilians could gain access to this area only with permission from ORG and the NORP authorities . By fax of DATE ORG refused ORG permission to access the FAC peninsula and FAC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants and other ORG activists arrived off the coast of the FAC peninsula by a vessel called the M / V Arctic Sunrise . Some of the activists went ashore at the beach of ORG and put up a banner . They were ordered to leave the area immediately by the police . The applicants , using a rubber dinghy , landed at ORG , which is south of FAC . Thereafter they walked QUANTITY northwards overland to Shelter CARDINAL , to the east of the base , where they were arrested on DATE at TIME and charged with trespassing .

CARDINAL . Shelter CARDINAL is one of several emergency shelters built along a road QUANTITY in length running from the built - up part of the base area to FAC . Emergency shelters have been built at intervals of QUANTITY along the road to ensure that base personnel are able to seek shelter in the event of sudden bad weather on their way out to the radar facility . Shelter CARDINAL is QUANTITY from the built - up part of FAC and QUANTITY from FAC .

CARDINAL . The exact size of the defence area was disputed between the parties . The ORG maintained that FAC comprised QUANTITY at the relevant time . After the events in question , on DATE , the area was reduced in size and the FAC peninsula became a non - prohibited area to which all civilians could gain access without permission . The applicants submitted that the exact size of the defence area was confidential and thus unknown to the public .

CARDINAL . An official map called “ Sheet no . DATE , ORG , scale CARDINAL:CARDINAL:CARDINAL ” was produced by ORG . The map bore the following indications : “ Place names , centres of population and other details DATE ” , “ Corrections DATE ” and “ Printed by the NORP Geodetical Survey DATE ” . The airfield was shown , but there was no indication of an air base . A similar map was reproduced photographically by GPE .

CARDINAL . Based on the map by ORG , another map was produced and published as an annex to a report published in DATE entitled “ Report on the relocation of ORG in DATE ” . This map , ( “ the annex map ” ) , had a bold line drawn on it which , according to ORG , demarcated FAC , comprising a large area exceeding the area of the FAC peninsula . The applicants disputed this assertion , pointing out that the origin of and reason for the line were unknown .
CARDINAL . In DATE FAC was not fenced off or marked with signs , save for some “ No Entry ” signs by the harbour and on the road leading from the airfield to the built - up part of the base .

CARDINAL . At the time of their arrest the applicants were in possession of a Global Positioning System ( GPS device ) and the official Saga map of the area , on which they had marked CARDINAL different positions . In a notebook found on CARDINAL of the applicants the CARDINAL positions were listed with the corresponding degrees of latitude and longitude and the following descriptions : “ initial landing ” “ radar ( E ) ” , “ radar ( W ) ” and “ airstrip ” . The applicants were also carrying cameras and a camcorder . The police seized a film containing photos taken by the applicants during their walk . Some of the photos showed the applicants holding banners with the wording “ Stop Star Wars ” and “ No to new arms race ” , with some of the military facilities of FAC pictured in the background .

CARDINAL . Material downloaded from the ORG website at the relevant time contained various statements , including the following : “ But still inside , DATE into FAC are CARDINAL other activists , who have been walking and camping in LOC conditions since DATE , and so far remain undetected ” and an extract from a so - called action line recording by the activist saying “ We are now on DATE of our walk ... it 's been DATE , we 've been blasted by the wind , gotten cold every time we stopped , forded deep icy cold rivers , walked across ice , but also had some real beauty ... ” .
CARDINAL . The applicants were released on DATE at TIME , after indictments of the same date had been served on them . The charges against them were detailed as follows :

“ Violation of Article CARDINAL of the Penal Code and Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL , taken together with [ Article CARDINAL ] § CARDINAL and section CARDINAL ) of Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on travel to and within GPE ( ORG om rejser til og i LOC ) ( “ FAC ) in that , without permission having been granted to the environmental organisation ORG , [ the applicants ] , using a rubber dinghy from the vessel M / V Artic Sunrise , went ashore on DATE in the area around ( ved ) FAC , where they took pictures with cameras and video cameras , and were found by the police at FAC on DATE at TIME ”

CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE given in absentia , the applicants were convicted as charged by ORG of GPE ( Grønlands Landsret ) . They were each sentenced to a fine of CARDINAL Danish kroner ( ORG ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) . In handing down the sentence , the court took into account the fact that , as ORG activists , the applicants had participated in a carefully planned action . In addition , the notebook , the Saga map of the air base area , a video film and fiftyone photos had been confiscated . The relevant parts of the ORG judgment stated :

“ On the evidence , the court finds that [ the applicants ] carried out the acts described in the indictment . As [ the applicants ] did not obtain permission to enter the base area , as required by section CARDINAL ) of Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on travel to and within GPE , they have violated section CARDINAL of the Order . As made clear by the explanatory notes to LAW , ORG has as its legal basis “ established practice ” within the meaning of LAW .

In view of the location of the base and considering that the applicants , aiming for the base , had to walk QUANTITY across rough terrain and that access to the base requires special permission under ORG , the court finds that the base is a “ place not freely accessible ” for the purposes of Article CARDINAL ( i ) of LAW . Accordingly , and as their presence was unauthorised , as stated above , [ the applicants ] are found guilty of having violated Article CARDINAL ( i ) of LAW . ”

CARDINAL . The applicants appealed to ORG of Eastern Denmark ( PERSON ) before which they argued , as they had done before the firstinstance court , that the act in question did not constitute a criminal offence .

CARDINAL . According to them , Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , relied on by the prosecution , did not have legal authority . Concerning Article CARDINALa ( i ) of LAW , they submitted that it could not be established whether or not they had trespassed , as the limits of the military area had never been officially defined . The applicants further maintained that lay judges should have participated in the proceedings before the firstinstance court . However , the latter complaint was later withdrawn .
CARDINAL . NORP Before ORG of LOC the prosecution submitted the annex map in support of the charge that the applicants had entered a “ place not freely accessible ” within the meaning of LAW .
CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE the High Court of Eastern GPE confirmed the first - instance court 's judgment stating , inter alia :

“ On the evidence produced before ORG , [ the applicants ] are found guilty of a violation of section CARDINAL ) of Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on the grounds stated in the judgment . As [ the applicants ] thus gained unauthorised access to a place not freely accessible , they have also violated Article CARDINAL ( i ) of LAW . In view of the nature of the area , this violation is not insignificant . ”
CARDINAL . The applicants ' request of DATE for leave to appeal against the judgment to ORG was refused by ORG ( Procesbevillingsnævnet ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on travel to and within GPE ( Rejsebekendtgørelsen ) ( “ the Travel Order ” ) , as amended by Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , was issued by the then ORG . It was promulgated in ORG ( p. CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section CARDINAL of ORG , any person may enter or leave GPE without limitation , subject to the restrictions laid down in ORG and in the Aliens ' LAW ( Lov om udlændinges adgang til landet m.v . ) and the provisions enacted under the latter .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of ORG provides detailed rules on entry to and residence in the defence areas in GPE established in accordance with the agreement on the defence of GPE signed on CARDINAL DATE by ORG and GPE under LOC . Section CARDINAL ) of the Order reads as follows :

“ ... In order to obtain access to the defence areas , persons other than those referred to in paragraphs ( a ) , ( b ) , and ( c ) [ certain military personnel , etc . ] must obtain permission for each trip from ORG for GPE or DATE subject to the latter 's authorisation – from other ORG authorities , in addition to permission from the relevant military authority if required . ”
CARDINAL . Breaches of ORG are punishable by a fine under section CARDINAL of the Order taken in conjunction with LAW of LAW for GPE no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ( see below ) ) .
ORG entered into force on DATE in accordance with section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . At the same time , Executive Order no . CARDINAL of DATE issued by ORG on travel to and within GPE ( the DATE Travel Order ) , as amended by ORG of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE on permission to travel through the defence areas , was repealed under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG .

CARDINAL . Apart from the applicants ' criminal case , the punitive sanctions provided for by Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE have never been applied . According to documents from ORG ( PERSON ) ( Ministry of GPE file no CARDINAL - CARDINAL - CARDINAL containing correspondence from DATE between the NORP military liaison officer at FAC and ORG ) , a woman was found to have travelled to FAC on DATE on the false pretext of visiting a married couple at FAC . It turned out that she was not visiting any local inhabitants , but a male worker at FAC base , who was forced to resign his job at the base as a result of the incident . Although it appears that the woman breached ORG by giving false information in order to gain access to the base , no charges were brought against her .

CARDINAL . ORG Executive Order no . CARDINAL of DATE on travel to and within GPE entered into force on DATE . Section CARDINAL stipulated that the rules laid down in the Order applied to NORP nationals ' entry to and residence in GPE .

CARDINAL . The Executive Order introduced for the first time a provision on access to defence areas in GPE . Hence , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Order , military and civilian personnel whose presence in the defence areas or on other sites in GPE was necessary in connection with activities pursuant to the DATE agreement between ORG and GPE on the defence of GPE , and members of their families , were allowed to enter and leave the defence areas or other such sites in GPE .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG , persons other than those referred to in subsection ( CARDINAL ) could gain access to the defence areas in GPE established pursuant to the agreements referred to in subsection ( CARDINAL ) , and which the Government of GPE were responsible for operating and maintaining , only if they had obtained prior special permission from ORG or from the Governor of GPE under the authority of ORG , in addition to permission from the relevant military authority if required .
CARDINAL . Breaches of Executive Order no . CARDINAL of DATE were punishable by a fine under section CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Executive Order no . CARDINAL of DATE on travel to and within GPE entered into force on DATE in accordance with section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) . At the same time , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW , ORG issued by ORG on DATE on travel to and within GPE was repealed .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Executive Order of CARDINAL DATE on travel to and within GPE , issued by ORG , specified that unless otherwise provided by special treaty between GPE and other countries or by other special provision , travels to and within GPE were subject to special permission from ORG .
CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Order , breaches of its provisions were punishable by a fine .
The DATE LAW for GPE and
criminal - law practice before its entry into force

CARDINAL . The Danish Penal Code does not apply in GPE . Before DATE , the criminal law of GPE consisted solely of the practice developed by the district courts of GPE on the basis of fragmentary provisions in old legislation . GPE had colonial status and was a predominantly closed country before the revision of LAW in DATE . The ORG submitted that , until the DATE Travel Order entered into force , neither NORP nor foreigners had had access to the country without special permission , under provisions dating back as far as DATE . The applicants disputed this , arguing that GPE had been opened up as a result of the PERSON reforms laws of DATE .
CARDINAL . The DATE revision of LAW extended its scope of application to all parts of the NORP realm , including GPE .

CARDINAL . With LAW for GPE no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , most elements of the practice developed by the districts courts of GPE were given statutory form . LAW was adopted on DATE and became law by royal assent on DATE . It entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . Under LAW for GPE , the sanctions authorised by the Code may be imposed only for offences referred to in the LAW or equivalent offences ( the principle of legality ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL reads as follows :
“ Any individual who without good cause
( i ) obtains access to another person 's house or any other place not freely accessible ( skaffer sig adgang til fremmed hus eller andet ikke frit tilgængeligt sted ) , or
( ii ) fails to leave another person 's house having been requested to do so
may be convicted of trespassing . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL contained the following provision :

The rules on fines , forfeiture and compensation and other lesser sanctions laid down by provisions still in force shall remain in force subject to the amendments which follow from Parts CARDINAL to CARDINAL and DATE to CARDINAL of this Code . Negligent breaches of such provisions shall give rise to liability to the same extent as hitherto .

Provisions that are issued in accordance with established practice ( bestemmelser , som udstedes i medfør af hidtil gældende praksis ) , including bye - laws issued by ORG ) and local authorities , may lay down rules on the imposition of cautions , fines , ouster and exclusion orders , forfeiture and confiscation , and disqualification from carrying on a trade or operating vessels or vehicles and from other similar rights based on official authorisation .
CARDINAL . The explanatory notes to Article CARDINAL stated as follows :

“ This provision , which has been prepared under the authority of ORG , preserves a number of administrative rules on fines , forfeiture and compensation and other lesser sanctions . These represent various rules with a public - law content . The provision also confers legal authority to issue such rules in accordance with established practice . Although it has been found necessary in LAW to lay down the principle , which is new for GPE , that the imposition of criminal - law sanctions must be authorised by statute , it has not been considered possible to fully implement the principle during the period of transition in which GPE currently finds itself in terms of its economy , society and culture . ”
CARDINAL . Act no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , which entered into force on DATE , amended the provisions of LAW , inserting a new LAW .
CARDINAL . Act no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE revised the provisions of LAW for GPE concerning sanctions . A new LAW was inserted , which read as follows :

“ Regulations that are issued in accordance with established practice ( i forskrifter , der udstedes i overensstemmelse med hidtil gældende praksis ) , including bye - laws issued by ORG and local authorities , may stipulate that violations of such regulations are punishable by fines , forfeiture and confiscation and disqualifications . Such sanctions shall then be applied in accordance with the rules in DATE , CARDINAL to DATE and CARDINAL of this Code . ”
The LAW entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . By Act no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , which entered into force on DATE , LAW for GPE was once more amended . A new LAW was inserted , which read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . NORP The Minister of Justice may issue regulations on access to certain parts of GPE , and the conditions [ for such access ] , including the inland ice , FAC in LOC and LOC and access to and from the defence areas established pursuant to the agreement of DATE between the ORG of GPE and GPE on the defence of GPE .

CARDINAL . With regard to intentional or negligent breaches of the provisions set out in regulations adopted under subsection CARDINAL , rules may be laid down imposing measures as set out in LAW [ for instance , fines and confiscation ] . ”
CARDINAL . The preparatory notes to the LAW ( LCARDINAL , introduced on DATE ) stated , among other things ( section CARDINAL ) :

“ The Executive Order on travel to and within GPE [ Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ] , issued by the then ORG , has as its legal basis “ established practice ” within the meaning of LAW of LAW . The required amendments [ to LAW , for example , the insertion of LAW ] were not undertaken earlier by means of administrative measures , since the new rules in question could hardly be issued under the authority of the said provision [ LAW ] . ”

CARDINAL . It appears from the explanatory notes to the PERSON that the purpose of inserting the enabling provision in LAW was to provide a legal basis for updating rules in that field and , in that connection , to expand the authorities ' right to regulate expedition activities in GPE for the particular purpose of limiting the number of cases where rescue operations had to be launched and of facilitating the implementation of rescue operations .
CARDINAL . At the time of the events in the present case the Minister of ORG had not issued any regulations under LAW .

CARDINAL . Since the entry into force on DATE of the Penal Code for GPE ( Act no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , there have been no examples of executive orders issued “ in accordance with established practice ” taking LAW ( later ORG CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL respectively ) as their legal basis , with the exception of Executive Order no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on travel to and within GPE . Various local bye - laws ( Politivedtægter ) , however , have been issued on the basis of this legal authority and by DATE charges had been brought in CARDINAL cases concerning violations of these bye - laws .
